Dear Ms. Moore:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/09/2019. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 An explanation why previous CAP have not been obtained and maintained
compliance for rules found in repeat noncompliance.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
4

The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit a corrective action plan for the January 21,
2017 renewal inspection report.
The corrective action plan is related to Special Investigation 2018C0201019. The
investigation related to an allegation that the adoptive child was ineligible for the
adoption assistance program and the adoptive family was not able to receive
financial assistance or Medicaid from the program due to the agency staff finalizing
the adoptive child’s adoption without obtaining the required MDHHS signature on the
adoption assistance agreement. The agency received a citation for R400.12205 (8)
(b) Staff responsibilities. The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan
that indicated the agency admitted responsibility and made the necessary steps to
facilitate payments for the child’s insurance until 2021. The special investigation was
closed on 08/15/2018 and there was no changes in the current license status.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Lutheran Adoption Services
will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
